intro: Spennera polystachya, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Spennera polystachya is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
